meanings.definition: Relating to the Greek god Dionysus or the cult of worship associated with him.
meanings.sent1: The dionysian festival celebrated the god Dionysus with music and dance.
meanings.sent2: The ancient Greeks held dionysian rituals to honor their deity.
meanings.sent3: At the dionysian gathering, everyone wore grapevine wreaths.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, a dionysian symphony of joy.
meanings.sent5: The dionysian procession was a colorful spectacle of revelry and merriment.

meanings.definition: Characterized by unrestrained indulgence in pleasure and excess.
meanings.sent1: The party turned dionysian as people danced wildly and drank without limit.
meanings.sent2: His dionysian lifestyle led to late nights and extravagant spending.
meanings.sent3: The dionysian feast left everyone feeling both satisfied and guilty.
meanings.sent4: The dionysian atmosphere of the carnival was infectious, drawing in all who passed by.
meanings.sent5: Her dionysian appetite for adventure knew no bounds, always seeking the next thrill.
